summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2021 between a federal prosecutor and a FedEx paralegal, Tracy Chapell, regarding the authentication of FedEx shipping records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecutor is seeking a records custodian to testify at Maxwell's upcoming trial, and the emails discuss obtaining a signed declaration and historical shipment data from 2007-2020.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal, Litigation at FedEx Express
persons.context: FedEx employee corresponding with federal prosecutors to authenticate shipping records and potentially testify as a records custodian in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming criminal trial in New York for which the FedEx records are being sought.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier; the FedEx records search is associated with him and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the investigation and trial; FedEx records are being sought for accounts associated with both individuals.
Chapell is assisting prosecutors in authenticating records that may be used as evidence in Maxwell's trial.
Chapell is providing FedEx shipment data from an account associated with Jeffrey Epstein (2007-2020).

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx from SD Florida
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx, with Tracy Ferrara as the point of contact.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: Criminal trial for Ghislaine Maxwell scheduled to start in New York.

events.title: FedEx Records Authentication
events.description: Email correspondence between a federal prosecutor and FedEx paralegal Tracy Chapell to authenticate shipping records and secure a witness for the Maxwell trial.

locations: 3620 Hacks Cross Road Building B 3rd Floor Memphis, TN 38125
1 Saint Andrews Plaza New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively preparing for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in 2021 by seeking to authenticate FedEx shipping records.
FedEx provided a spreadsheet of shipments from an account associated with Jeffrey Epstein for the years 2007-2020.
A prior subpoena for FedEx records was issued in February 2008 by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, indicating earlier investigative interest.
The prosecutor's correspondence confirms the search was for accounts or data associated with both Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The email chain shows procedural steps to establish a records custodian who could testify at trial, including signing a declaration.
